title: Parse Error: Syntax Error, Unexpected Token
message: Parse error: syntax error, unexpected 'some_token' (T_SOME_TOKEN) in file.php on line X
causes: Missing semicolon, curly brace, or parenthesis in PHP code.
Using reserved keywords or invalid syntax.
Copy-pasted code with hidden characters or mismatched quotes.
solutions: Check syntax: Look for missing `;`, `)`, or `}` near line X.
Validate code: Use `php -l file.php` to lint the file for syntax errors.
Enable error display: Set `display_errors = On` in `php.ini` or `ini_set('display_errors', 1);` for detailed messages.

title: Notice: Undefined Variable
message: Notice: Undefined variable: someVar in file.php on line X
causes: Using a variable before defining it.
Typo in variable name.
Variable out of scope (e.g., not passed to a function).
solutions: Define variable: Ensure `$someVar` is defined before use (`$someVar = null;`).
Check scope: Pass variable to functions (`function myFunc($someVar)`) or use globals cautiously (`global $someVar;`).
Use error suppression (not recommended): `isset($someVar) ? $someVar : null` or `@$someVar`.

title: Fatal Error: Undefined Function
message: Fatal error: Uncaught Error: Call to undefined function someFunction() in file.php on line X
causes: Function not defined or not included.
Missing PHP extension required for the function.
Typo in function name or incorrect namespace.
solutions: Define function: Ensure `someFunction()` is defined in the script or included file.
Check extensions: Install missing extensions (`sudo apt-get install php-mbstring` for `mb_`* functions).
Verify namespace: Use correct namespace (`use Namespace\someFunction;`) or fully qualified name.

title: Fatal Error: Maximum Execution Time Exceeded
message: Fatal error: Maximum execution time of 30 seconds exceeded in file.php on line X
causes: Script execution taking too long (e.g., infinite loop, heavy processing).
Default PHP timeout (`max_execution_time`) reached.
Slow external calls (e.g., database queries, API requests).
solutions: Increase timeout: `set_time_limit(60);` or `ini_set('max_execution_time', 60);` for 60 seconds.
Optimize code: Check for infinite loops (`while(true)`) or optimize database queries.
Use asynchronous processing: Offload heavy tasks to a queue (e.g., with `gearman` or Laravel Queues).

title: Warning: Cannot Modify Header Information
message: Warning: Cannot modify header information - headers already sent by (output started at file.php:X)
causes: Output (e.g., `echo`, whitespace) sent before `header()` or `session_start()`.
Including files that output content before headers.
UTF-8 BOM (Byte Order Mark) in script causing output.
solutions: Avoid output before headers: Move `header()` or `session_start()` before any output.
Check for BOM: Save file without BOM in editor (e.g., VS Code: 'Save without BOM').
Enable output buffering: `ob_start();` at the start of script, `ob_end_flush();` at the end.

title: Notice: Undefined Index
message: Notice: Undefined index: someKey in file.php on line X
causes: Accessing an array key that doesn’t exist (e.g., `$_POST['someKey']`).
Not checking existence of key before access.
Typo in array key name.
solutions: Check existence: `isset($_POST['someKey']) ? $_POST['someKey'] : null`.
Use array_key_exists: `array_key_exists('someKey', $_POST)`.
Set default: Use null coalescing operator (`$_POST['someKey'] ?? 'default'` in PHP 7+).

title: Fatal Error: Class Not Found
message: Fatal error: Uncaught Error: Class 'SomeClass' not found in file.php on line X
causes: Class file not included or autoloaded.
Typo in class name or namespace.
Missing Composer autoload setup.
solutions: Include file: `require_once 'path/to/SomeClass.php';`.
Use autoloading: Set up Composer autoload (`require 'vendor/autoload.php';`) or PSR-4.
Check namespace: Ensure correct `use Namespace\SomeClass;` or fully qualified name.

title: MySQLi Connection Failed
message: Warning: mysqli_connect(): (HY000/2002): No such file or directory in file.php on line X
causes: MySQL server not running or unreachable.
Incorrect database credentials or host in `mysqli_connect()`.
Socket path or port misconfigured.
solutions: Start MySQL: `sudo systemctl start mysql` or `mysqld`.
Verify credentials: Check `mysqli_connect('host', 'user', 'pass', 'db')` parameters.
Specify socket/port: Use `mysqli_connect('localhost:3306', ..., ['/path/to/socket'])`.

title: Session Start Fails Silently
message: No error raised, but session data not persisted.
causes: Not calling `session_start()` before accessing `$_SESSION`.
Session directory not writable (`session.save_path`).
Cookies disabled in browser affecting session ID.
solutions: Start session: `session_start();` at the top of script.
Check permissions: Ensure `session.save_path` directory is writable (`chmod 777 /path`).
Enable cookies: Warn users to enable cookies or use URL-based sessions (`session.use_only_cookies = 0`).

title: Composer Autoload Not Working
message: Fatal error: Uncaught Error: Class 'Vendor\Namespace\Class' not found
causes: Composer autoload not generated (`vendor/autoload.php` missing).
Namespace or directory structure not matching PSR-4/PSR-0.
Not running `composer dump-autoload` after changes.
solutions: Generate autoload: `composer dump-autoload` after adding new classes.
Check PSR-4 mapping: Ensure `composer.json` maps namespaces (`"Vendor\\Namespace\\": "src/"`).
Require autoload: `require_once 'vendor/autoload.php';` at script start.

title: Fatal Error: Allowed Memory Size Exhausted
message: Fatal error: Allowed memory size of 134217728 bytes exhausted (tried to allocate X bytes) in file.php on line Y
causes: Script consuming more memory than `memory_limit` allows.
Large arrays, recursion, or image processing overloading memory.
Memory leaks from unoptimized loops.
solutions: Increase memory limit: `ini_set('memory_limit', '256M');` or edit `php.ini`.
Optimize code: Process data in chunks, unset variables (`unset($largeArray);`).
Profile memory: Use `memory_get_usage()` to trace memory spikes.

title: Unexpected Behavior Due to Implicit Type Casting
message: No error raised, but comparison or arithmetic yields unexpected results.
causes: PHP implicitly casting types (e.g., `'123'` to `123` in comparisons).
Using loose comparison (`==`) instead of strict (`===`).
Not validating input types before operations.
solutions: Use strict comparison: `$a === $b` instead of `$a == $b`.
Explicit casting: `(int)$value` or `(string)$value` before operations.
Validate types: `is_int($value)` or `is_string($value)` before use.

title: Notice: Array to String Conversion
message: Notice: Array to string conversion in file.php on line X
causes: Trying to echo or concatenate an array directly.
Passing an array where a string is expected.
Not accessing specific array element.
solutions: Access element: `echo $array['key'];` instead of `echo $array;`.
Convert array: `implode(',', $array)` to join array into string.
Debug array: `var_dump($array);` or `print_r($array);` to inspect.

title: Silent Failure of File Write
message: No error raised, but file content not written.
causes: Not checking return value of `file_put_contents()` or `fwrite()`.
Insufficient write permissions for file or directory.
Disk full or file system issues.
solutions: Check return: `$result = file_put_contents('file.txt', $data); if ($result === false) { die('Write failed'); }`.
Verify permissions: `chmod 666 file.txt` or ensure directory writable (`chmod 777 dir`).
Monitor disk: `df -h` to check available space.

title: Unexpected Behavior Due to Magic Quotes
message: No error raised, but user input contains unexpected backslashes.
causes: Using deprecated `magic_quotes_gpc` setting in old PHP versions.
Input data being automatically escaped (`get_magic_quotes_gpc()`).
Not normalizing input before processing.
solutions: Disable magic quotes: `magic_quotes_gpc = Off` in `php.ini` (PHP < 5.4).
Strip slashes: `if (get_magic_quotes_gpc()) { $data = stripslashes($data); }`.
Upgrade PHP: Use modern PHP versions (magic quotes removed since PHP 5.4).

title: Laravel: TokenMismatchException
message: TokenMismatchException in VerifyCsrfToken.php line X
causes: CSRF token missing or invalid in form submission.
Session expired or CSRF cookie not sent.
Cross-origin requests not including CSRF token.
solutions: Add CSRF token: Include `@csrf` directive in forms (`<form method='POST'>@csrf</form>`).
Pass via header: For AJAX, include token (`X-CSRF-TOKEN: {{ csrf_token() }}`).
Exclude route: Add URI to `$except` in `VerifyCsrfToken` middleware (not recommended for POST).

title: Symfony: 500 Internal Server Error
message: 500 Internal Server Error - An error occurred.
causes: Unhandled exception in Symfony controller or service.
Misconfigured environment (e.g., `.env` file).
Database connection failure or dependency issue.
solutions: Check logs: View `var/log/dev.log` or `prod.log` for detailed errors.
Enable debug mode: Run `APP_ENV=dev php bin/console cache:clear` for detailed output.
Verify config: Ensure `.env` has correct DB credentials (`DATABASE_URL`).

title: Unexpected Behavior Due to Variable Scope in Closures
message: No error raised, but closure uses unexpected variable values.
causes: Not using `use` keyword to bind variables in closures.
Variable modified outside closure after binding.
Assuming pass-by-value when pass-by-reference is needed.
solutions: Bind with `use`: `$fn = function() use ($var) { echo $var; };`.
Pass by reference: `use (&$var)` if variable needs to reflect changes.
Debug value: `var_dump($var)` inside closure to trace.

title: Warning: PDO Connection Failed
message: Warning: PDO::__construct(): SQLSTATE[HY000] [2002] Connection refused
causes: Database server not running or unreachable.
Incorrect PDO DSN or credentials.
Firewall or network issues blocking connection.
solutions: Start database: `sudo systemctl start mysql` or equivalent.
Verify DSN: `$pdo = new PDO('mysql:host=localhost;dbname=db', 'user', 'pass');`.
Test connection: `telnet localhost 3306` to check port accessibility.

title: Composer Dependency Conflict
message: Your requirements could not be resolved to an installable set of packages.
causes: Conflicting version constraints in `composer.json`.
Dependency requiring incompatible PHP version.
Outdated `composer.lock` file causing mismatch.
solutions: Update Composer: `composer self-update`.
Resolve conflicts: Adjust versions in `composer.json` or use `composer why-not package:version`.
Clear lock file: `rm composer.lock && composer install` to regenerate.

title: Silent Failure in Session Storage
message: No error raised, but session data not saved.
causes: Session storage directory (`session.save_path`) not writable.
Session handler misconfigured (e.g., Redis, Memcached down).
Not calling `session_write_close()` before script ends.
solutions: Set save path: `ini_set('session.save_path', '/writable/path');` and `chmod 777 /writable/path`.
Verify handler: If using Redis, ensure `redis-server` is running (`redis-cli ping`).
Close session: `session_write_close();` after modifying `$_SESSION`.

title: Unexpected Behavior Due to Magic Methods
message: No error raised, but object behavior inconsistent.
causes: Incorrect implementation of `__get`, `__set`, or `__call`.
Infinite recursion in magic methods.
Not handling edge cases in magic method logic.
solutions: Avoid recursion: `public function __get($name) { return $this->data[$name]; }`.
Debug access: Add `error_log('Accessing $name');` to trace calls.
Validate input: Check `$name` in `__get`/`__set` to avoid undefined behavior.

title: PHP Warning: Division By Zero
message: Warning: Division by zero in file.php on line X
causes: Dividing a number by zero.
Variable unexpectedly evaluates to zero.
Not validating denominator before division.
solutions: Check for zero: `if ($denominator != 0) { $result = $numerator / $denominator; } else { $result = 0; }`.
Use error handling: `try { $result = $numerator / $denominator; } catch (DivisionByZeroError $e) { $result = 0; }` (PHP 7+).
Debug variable: `var_dump($denominator);` before division.

title: Unexpected Behavior Due to Superglobals Modification
message: No error raised, but `$_GET`, `$_POST`, etc., behave unexpectedly.
causes: Directly modifying superglobals (`$_GET['key'] = 'value';`) affecting logic.
Assuming superglobals are immutable.
Not sanitizing superglobals before use.
solutions: Avoid modification: Use local variables (`$input = $_GET['key'];`).
Sanitize input: `filter_input(INPUT_GET, 'key', FILTER_SANITIZE_STRING)`.
Debug usage: `var_dump($_GET);` before and after suspected changes.

title: Laravel: Migration Fails Due to Foreign Key Constraint
message: SQLSTATE[HY000]: General error: 1215 Cannot add foreign key constraint
causes: Referenced table or column does not exist during migration.
Mismatch in column types between tables (e.g., unsigned vs not).
Running migrations out of order.
solutions: Ensure table exists: Create referenced table first (`Schema::create('parent_table', ...)`).
Match column types: `$table->unsignedBigInteger('user_id'); $table->foreign('user_id')->references('id')->on('users');`.
Run migrations in order: `php artisan migrate --pretend` to check SQL, then `php artisan migrate`.

title: PHP Warning: Failed to Open Stream
message: Warning: include(file.php): failed to open stream: No such file or directory in file.php on line X
causes: File path incorrect or file missing.
Incorrect permissions preventing file access.
Relative path failing due to script execution directory.
solutions: Verify path: Ensure `file.php` exists (`ls file.php` or `dir file.php`).
Use absolute path: `include __DIR__ . '/file.php';`.
Check permissions: `chmod 644 file.php` and ensure directory readable.

title: Unexpected Behavior Due to Output Buffering
message: No error raised, but output appears in wrong order or not at all.
causes: Output buffering enabled (`ob_start()`) but not flushed.
Nested output buffers causing delayed output.
Not clearing buffer before sending headers.
solutions: Flush buffer: `ob_start(); echo 'content'; ob_end_flush();`.
Clear buffer: `ob_clean();` before new output if needed.
Disable buffering: Avoid `ob_start()` unless necessary.

title: Silent Logging Failure
message: No error raised, but logs not written to file.
causes: Log file or directory not writable.
Error logging disabled (`error_log` not set in `php.ini`).
Custom logger misconfigured (e.g., Monolog in Laravel).
solutions: Set log file: `ini_set('error_log', '/path/to/logfile.log');` and `chmod 666 logfile.log`.
Enable logging: `log_errors = On` in `php.ini`.
Check logger: For Monolog, ensure handler set (`$log->pushHandler(new StreamHandler('path/to/log'))`).

title: Unexpected Behavior Due to Timezone Misconfiguration
message: No error raised, but dates/times incorrect.
causes: PHP default timezone not set (`date.timezone`).
Server timezone differing from application logic.
Not specifying timezone in date functions.
solutions: Set timezone: `date_default_timezone_set('UTC');` or `date.timezone = 'UTC'` in `php.ini`.
Use DateTime: `$dt = new DateTime('now', new DateTimeZone('UTC'));`.
Verify server: `date` command to check server timezone.

title: Apache 500 Internal Server Error
message: 500 Internal Server Error: The server encountered an internal error.
causes: PHP fatal error not displayed due to `display_errors = Off`.
`.htaccess` misconfiguration causing rewrite errors.
Permissions or ownership issues on PHP files.
solutions: Check logs: View Apache error log (`/var/log/apache2/error.log` or `/var/log/httpd/error_log`).
Enable errors: `ini_set('display_errors', 1); error_reporting(E_ALL);` in script.
Fix permissions: `chmod 644 file.php && chown www-data:www-data file.php` (assuming `www-data` user).

title: Invariant Violation: ViewPropTypes has been removed
message: Invariant Violation: ViewPropTypes has been removed from React Native.
causes: Using deprecated `ViewPropTypes` in a component.
Third-party library relying on outdated React Native APIs.
Incomplete upgrade to a newer React Native version.
solutions: Replace `ViewPropTypes` with `StyleSheet` or direct style props.
Update the third-party library to a version compatible with React Native 0.62+.
Follow the React Native upgrade guide for deprecated APIs.

title: AsyncStorage not persisting data
message: Data stored in AsyncStorage disappears after app restart.
causes: Incorrect usage of AsyncStorage API (e.g., not awaiting promises).
Storage limit exceeded for AsyncStorage.
App permissions or iOS simulator issues clearing storage.
solutions: Ensure proper async/await usage: `await AsyncStorage.setItem('key', value)`.
Use alternative storage like `react-native-mmkv` for larger data.
Clear simulator data or reset permissions if needed.

title: React Native app stuck on 'Loading dependency graph'
message: Metro Bundler hangs on 'Loading dependency graph, done.'
causes: Large project with many dependencies slowing Metro.
Port conflict (default port 8081 already in use).
Corrupted Metro cache or node_modules.
solutions: Run Metro on a different port: `npx react-native start --port 8082`.
Clear Metro cache: `npx react-native start --reset-cache`.
Delete `node_modules` and reinstall dependencies.

title: Jest tests fail with React Native
message: Jest test suite fails with errors like 'Unexpected token' or 'Cannot find module'.
causes: Missing Jest preset for React Native.
Incorrect setup of Jest mocks for native modules.
Babel configuration mismatch for React Native.
solutions: Add `preset: 'react-native'` in `jest.config.js`.
Mock native modules using `jest.mock('react-native-some-module')`.
Ensure Babel is configured correctly in `babel.config.js`.

title: Unable to connect to React Native Debugger
message: React Native Debugger fails to connect, showing 'Waiting for React to connect'.
causes: Incorrect port configuration in React Native Debugger.
Metro Bundler running on a different port than expected.
Network issues blocking WebSocket connection.
solutions: Set the correct port in React Native Debugger (default: 8081).
Check Metro port: `npx react-native start --port 8081`.
Disable firewall or VPN temporarily to test connection.

title: App freezes during heavy computation
message: App becomes unresponsive when performing complex operations.
causes: Blocking the main thread with synchronous computations.
Large JSON parsing or data processing in JavaScript thread.
Unoptimized component rendering during state updates.
solutions: Offload heavy tasks to native modules or Web Workers.
Use `react-native-background-task` for background processing.
Optimize rendering with `React.memo` or `useMemo`.

title: Incorrect splash screen image size
message: Splash screen image appears stretched or pixelated.
causes: Incorrect image dimensions for device resolutions.
Missing multiple resolution assets (@2x, @3x).
Improper configuration in `android/app/src/main/res` or iOS.
solutions: Provide images for all resolutions (e.g., `splash.png`, `splash@2x.png`).
Configure `launch_screen.xml` (Android) or LaunchScreen.storyboard (iOS).
Use `react-native-splash-screen` library for easier setup.

title: FlatList not rendering items
message: FlatList renders an empty list despite having data.
causes: Missing `keyExtractor` or `renderItem` props.
Data prop not an array or incorrectly formatted.
Height or width of FlatList not set in styles.
solutions: Add `keyExtractor={(item) => item.id.toString()}` and `renderItem`.
Ensure `data` prop is an array: `data={Array.isArray(data) ? data : []}`.
Set explicit styles: `style={{ flex: 1 }}` on FlatList.

title: React Native app fails on TestFlight
message: App works fine locally but crashes on TestFlight builds.
causes: Missing bitcode or incorrect build settings in Xcode.
Environment variables not set for production builds.
Code signing issues or provisioning profile mismatch.
solutions: Enable bitcode in Xcode: `Build Settings > Enable Bitcode`.
Ensure `.env` variables are included in production builds.
Verify code signing and provisioning profiles in Xcode.

title: Images not loading in production
message: Images load in development but fail in production builds.
causes: Relative paths used for images instead of imports.
Images not bundled properly in production.
Assets missing from `android/app/src/main/res` or iOS bundle.
solutions: Import images in JS: `import image from './image.png'`.
Use `react-native-asset` to link assets properly.
Verify assets are copied during production build.

title: State updates not reflecting in UI
message: State changes occur but the UI doesn’t update.
causes: Mutating state directly instead of using `setState` or hooks.
Shallow comparison failing due to nested objects.
Component not re-rendering due to memoization.
solutions: Use `setState` or `useState` hooks to update state.
Deep clone objects with spread operator: `setState({ ...state, updatedField })`.
Avoid unnecessary `React.memo` blocking updates.

title: React Native CLI build fails due to JDK mismatch
message: Gradle fails with 'Could not initialize class org.codehaus.groovy'.
causes: Using an incompatible JDK version for Android builds.
JAVA_HOME environment variable pointing to wrong JDK.
Outdated Gradle version in project.
solutions: Install JDK 11 and set `JAVA_HOME` environment variable.
Update Gradle in `android/gradle/wrapper/gradle-wrapper.properties`.
Run `./gradlew cleanBuildCache` to clear build issues.

title: Accessibility issues in React Native
message: Screen readers fail to interpret components correctly.
causes: Missing accessibility labels or roles on interactive elements.
Improper nesting of touchable components.
Dynamic content updates not announced to screen readers.
solutions: Add `accessibilityLabel` and `accessibilityRole` to components.
Ensure touchables wrap only one child: `<TouchableOpacity><View>...</View></TouchableOpacity>`.
Use `AccessibilityInfo.announceForAccessibility` for dynamic updates.

title: React Native Animated API causing stutter
message: Animations lag or stutter during execution.
causes: Using JavaScript-based animations on heavy UI updates.
Not utilizing `useNativeDriver` for animations.
Main thread blocked by other operations.
solutions: Enable `useNativeDriver: true` in Animated API calls.
Optimize UI updates by reducing re-renders.
Profile performance with React Native Performance Monitor.

title: React Native app rejected by Google Play
message: App submission rejected due to policy violations or crashes.
causes: Missing privacy policy for sensitive permissions.
App crashes due to unhandled edge cases in production.
APK not optimized for different device architectures.
solutions: Add a privacy policy link in Play Console and app.
Test edge cases on various devices before submission.
Generate App Bundle instead of APK for better compatibility.

title: Conflicting native module versions
message: App crashes due to duplicate native modules.
causes: Multiple packages including the same native dependency.
Incorrect linking of native modules.
Outdated dependency causing conflicts.
solutions: Resolve conflicts with `resolutions` field in `package.json` ( Yarn ).
Manually link native modules and check for duplicates.
Update all dependencies to compatible versions.

title: React Native CLI init fails with template error
message: 'npx react-native init' fails with 'Template not found'.
causes: Network issues preventing template download.
Using an outdated version of React Native CLI.
Corrupted npm/Yarn cache.
solutions: Clear npm/Yarn cache: `npm cache clean --force` or `yarn cache clean`.
Update React Native CLI: `npm install -g @react-native-community/cli`.
Retry with a stable internet connection.

title: App icon not updating after change
message: New app icon doesn’t appear after updating assets.
causes: Old icon cached in device or simulator.
Incorrect icon sizes or naming in `android/app/src/main/res` or iOS.
Build not cleaned after updating assets.
solutions: Clear device/simulator cache or uninstall/reinstall app.
Verify icon sizes and naming in `mipmap` (Android) or `Images.xcassets` (iOS).
Clean build: `cd android && ./gradlew clean` or Xcode clean.

title: Expo app fails to run on device
message: Expo Go app shows 'Something went wrong' when scanning QR code.
causes: Expo CLI not running locally.
Device and computer not on the same network.
Outdated Expo app on device.
solutions: Start Expo CLI: `npx expo start --tunnel`.
Ensure device and computer are on the same Wi-Fi network.
Update Expo Go app to the latest version.

title: React Native WebView not rendering
message: WebView component displays a blank screen.
causes: Missing `react-native-webview` package.
Invalid URL or HTTPS enforcement blocking content.
Content blocked by device security settings.
solutions: Install package: `npm install react-native-webview`.
Verify URL and use HTTPS (or bypass for development).
Check device logs for content security errors.

title: Hermes engine causing crashes
message: App crashes with Hermes engine enabled.
causes: Incompatible JavaScript syntax with Hermes.
Third-party library not Hermes-compatible.
Misconfigured Hermes in `android/app/build.gradle`.
solutions: Disable Hermes temporarily: `enableHermes: false` in `build.gradle`.
Update libraries to Hermes-compatible versions.
Polyfill unsupported syntax (e.g., `Proxy`, `Symbol`) with `react-native-get-random-values`.

title: Localization not working
message: App displays default language despite locale settings.
causes: Missing `react-native-localize` or `i18n-js` setup.
Device locale not detected correctly.
Translation files not formatted or loaded properly.
solutions: Set up localization with `react-native-localize` and `i18n-js`.
Detect locale: `import * as RNLocalize from 'react-native-localize'`.
Verify translation JSON files and loading logic.

title: React Native CLI outdated warning
message: Warning: You are using an outdated version of React Native CLI.
causes: Global CLI version not updated after Node upgrade.
Project using older CLI version in `package.json`.
Deprecated CLI commands causing warnings.
solutions: Update global CLI: `npm install -g @react-native-community/cli`.
Update CLI in project: `npm install @react-native-community/cli`.
Check for deprecated commands in scripts and replace.

title: Memory usage spikes on navigation
message: App slows down or crashes after navigating between screens.
causes: Large component trees not unmounted.
Images or assets not released from memory.
Navigation stack growing without cleanup.
solutions: Use navigation.replace() to avoid stacking screens.
Clear image caches: `Image.prefetch('url', () => {})`.
Unmount heavy components with lifecycle cleanup.

title: React Native Maps crashing on Android
message: App crashes when rendering MapView on Android.
causes: Missing Google Play Services API key.
Incorrect setup of `react-native-maps`.
Device lacking Play Services or emulator misconfiguration.
solutions: Add API key in `android/app/src/main/AndroidManifest.xml`.
Follow `react-native-maps` setup guide for Android.
Test on a device with Play Services or configure emulator.

title: Fast Refresh breaking state
message: State resets unexpectedly during Fast Refresh.
causes: Fast Refresh re-rendering components incorrectly.
Module exports changing during development.
Hot module replacement bugs in React Native.
solutions: Disable Fast Refresh temporarily: Shake device > Disable Fast Refresh.
Restart Metro Bundler after significant code changes.
Avoid exporting anonymous functions or components.

title: App size too large for submission
message: APK or IPA exceeds store size limits (e.g., Google Play 150MB).
causes: Large assets (images, videos) not optimized.
Unnecessary dependencies bloating the bundle.
Not using App Bundle format for Android.
solutions: Compress assets or use dynamic delivery for large files.
Audit dependencies with `react-native-bundle-visualizer`.
Generate App Bundle (AAB) for Android: `./gradlew bundleRelease`.

title: React Native Background Task not executing
message: Background tasks fail to run as expected.
causes: Missing native setup for background tasks.
Device battery optimizations killing background processes.
Improper usage of `react-native-background-fetch`.
solutions: Follow setup for `react-native-background-fetch` or similar libraries.
Prompt users to disable battery optimizations for the app.
Test background tasks in real device environments.

title: Deep linking not working
message: Deep links fail to open specific app screens.
causes: Missing URL scheme setup in `AndroidManifest.xml` or `Info.plist`.
Incorrect configuration of linking library (e.g., React Navigation).
App not handling incoming links properly.
solutions: Add URL scheme in `AndroidManifest.xml` and `Info.plist`.
Set up deep linking with React Navigation: `linking` prop in `NavigationContainer`.
Handle links using `Linking` API: `Linking.addEventListener('url', handleUrl)`.
Test deep links using `adb shell am start -W -a android.intent.action.VIEW -d 'your_deep_link_url' your.package.name` for Android or `xcrun simctl openurl booted 'your_deep_link_url'` for iOS.

title: React Native app fails on specific Android versions
message: App works on newer Android versions but crashes on older ones.
causes: Using APIs not available in older Android versions.
Missing polyfills for older JavaScript features.
Dependency not compatible with target Android SDK.
solutions: Check API usage and add fallbacks with `Platform.OS` and `Platform.Version`.
Add polyfills for older JS features (e.g., `core-js`).
Set minimum SDK version in `android/app/build.gradle` and test compatibility.

title: React Native app not connecting to Metro
message: App fails to connect to Metro Bundler during development.
causes: Network issues preventing device from reaching Metro server.
Firewall or security software blocking Metro connections.
Incorrect IP address or port in app configuration.
solutions: Check Metro address: Shake device > Dev settings > Debug server host & port for correct IP.
Disable firewall or VPN temporarily to test connection.
Restart Metro server with `npx react-native start`.

title: React Native TypeScript Errors After Setup
message: TS errors like 'Cannot find module' or 'Property does not exist on type'.
causes: Incorrect TypeScript configuration in `tsconfig.json`.
Missing type definitions for React Native libraries.
Incorrect file extensions (`ts`/`tsx`) for React Native components.
solutions: Ensure `tsconfig.json` includes `'jsx': 'react-native'` and proper paths.
Install type definitions: `npm install --save-dev @types/react-native`.
Use `.tsx` for files with JSX and `.ts` for pure TypeScript files.

title: React Native App Crashes on iOS 14+ Due to Privacy Changes
message: App crashes or fails due to new iOS privacy restrictions.
causes: Missing App Tracking Transparency (ATT) permission prompt.
Accessing device identifiers (e.g., IDFA) without user consent.
Third-party libraries not updated for iOS 14+ privacy rules.
solutions: Add `NSUserTrackingUsageDescription` to `Info.plist` and request permission with `react-native-permissions`.
Avoid accessing IDFA without consent or update libraries to comply.
Test on iOS 14+ simulators/devices to identify privacy violations.

title: React Native Reanimated Animations Not Working
message: Reanimated animations fail to execute or throw errors.
causes: Missing `@react-native-reanimated/babel-plugin` in `babel.config.js`.
Incorrect version of `react-native-reanimated` for React Native version.
Native dependencies not linked properly after installation.
solutions: Add `plugins: ['@react-native-reanimated/babel-plugin']` to `babel.config.js`.
Ensure version compatibility (e.g., Reanimated 2.x for RN 0.62+).
Run `npx pod-install` for iOS and rebuild Android app.

title: React Native Detox E2E Tests Failing
message: Detox tests fail with errors like 'Cannot find device' or 'Timed out waiting for app'.
causes: Incorrect Detox configuration in `package.json` or `.detoxrc.json`.
Simulator/emulator not running or not matching Detox config.
App binary not built for testing environment.
solutions: Verify Detox setup: `detox init -r react-native` and configure `.detoxrc.json`.
Start the correct simulator/emulator before running tests.
Build app for testing: `detox build --configuration ios.sim.debug`.

title: React Native App Fails to Build in CI Pipeline
message: Build fails in CI/CD (e.g., GitHub Actions, CircleCI) but works locally.
causes: Missing environment variables in CI pipeline.
Different Node.js or Ruby versions causing dependency issues.
Cached dependencies or build artifacts causing conflicts.
solutions: Set environment variables in CI (e.g., `NODE_ENV`, `JAVA_HOME`).
Pin Node.js and Ruby versions using `.nvmrc` and `.ruby-version`.
Clear cache in CI: `rm -rf node_modules && npm install`.

title: React Native Camera Not Working on Android
message: Camera fails to open or throws permission errors on Android.
causes: Missing camera permissions in `AndroidManifest.xml`.
Runtime permissions not requested for Android 6.0+.
Conflicting camera libraries causing crashes.
solutions: Add `<uses-permission android:name="android.permission.CAMERA" />` in `AndroidManifest.xml`.
Request runtime permissions with `react-native-permissions`.
Ensure only one camera library (e.g., `react-native-camera`) is used.

title: React Native App Crashes After RN Version Upgrade
message: App crashes or throws errors after upgrading React Native version.
causes: Deprecated APIs used in older code.
Third-party libraries not compatible with new RN version.
Incomplete upgrade process (e.g., missing native module updates).
solutions: Use `npx react-native upgrade` to update configs and files.
Check breaking changes in RN changelog and update code.
Update all dependencies to compatible versions.

title: React Native App Freezes on Splash Screen in Release Mode
message: App works in debug but freezes on splash screen in release builds.
causes: Uncaught JavaScript errors in release mode.
Proguard rules stripping necessary code in Android.
Missing Hermes or other optimizations causing crashes.
solutions: Debug release build with `npx react-native run-android --variant=release`.
Add Proguard exceptions in `android/app/proguard-rules.pro`.
Enable Hermes and verify setup in `android/app/build.gradle`.

title: React Native Push Notifications Not Delivered
message: Push notifications fail to reach devices in production.
causes: Incorrect FCM/APNs setup for production environment.
Invalid device token or registration with notification service.
App killed by OS before notification delivery.
solutions: Verify FCM setup (Android) and APNs certificates (iOS) in production.
Ensure device tokens are correctly registered with backend.
Use `react-native-push-notification` to handle foreground/background states.

title: React Native CodePush Updates Failing
message: OTA updates via CodePush fail to apply or download.
causes: Incorrect CodePush keys in `Info.plist` or `MainApplication.java`.
Mismatch between app version and CodePush deployment.
Network issues preventing bundle download.
solutions: Verify CodePush keys in `Info.plist` (iOS) and `MainApplication.java` (Android).
Ensure deployment keys match the app version in CodePush.
Test updates in staging environment and check network logs.

title: React Native Debugger Showing Stale State
message: Redux or React state in debugger shows outdated values.
causes: Debugger not refreshing state after Fast Refresh.
Redux middleware (e.g., `redux-thunk`) causing async delays.
State updates happening outside React lifecycle.
solutions: Disable Fast Refresh temporarily to stabilize debugger.
Add `redux-logger` to debug state changes in real-time.
Ensure state updates use React lifecycle methods or hooks.

title: React Native App Not Building on M1 Mac
message: iOS or Android build fails on Apple Silicon (M1) with architecture errors.
causes: Dependencies not compiled for arm64 architecture.
CocoaPods or Ruby tools not running natively on M1.
Xcode Rosetta emulation causing conflicts.
solutions: Run terminal in Rosetta mode or install native arm64 dependencies.
Update CocoaPods and Ruby: `sudo arch -x86_64 gem install cocoapods`.
Add `arm64` to excluded architectures in Xcode if needed.

title: React Native App Crashes on Specific iOS Devices
message: App works on simulator but crashes on certain iOS devices.
causes: Memory constraints on older devices causing crashes.
32-bit compatibility issues on newer iOS versions.
Device-specific bugs in native modules.
solutions: Optimize memory usage (e.g., reduce large image loads).
Build for 64-bit only in Xcode: `Build Settings > Architectures`.
Test on physical devices and debug with Xcode logs.

title: React Native App Not Respecting Dark Mode
message: App UI does not adapt to system dark/light mode.
causes: Missing `Appearance` API integration.
Hardcoded colors not adapting to theme changes.
Third-party UI libraries not supporting dark mode.
solutions: Use `Appearance` API: `import { Appearance } from 'react-native'`.
Define theme-based styles: `color: Appearance.getColorScheme() === 'dark' ? '#fff' : '#000'`.
Update libraries to versions with dark mode support.

title: React Native Metro Slow on Large Projects
message: Metro Bundler takes too long to start or refresh.
causes: Large dependency tree slowing Metro.
Too many files watched by Metro causing delays.
Insufficient system resources (e.g., CPU, RAM).
solutions: Optimize Metro config in `metro.config.js`: increase `maxWorkers`.
Exclude unused folders in Metro watcher: `watchFolders`.
Upgrade hardware or use a cloud-based dev environment.

title: React Native App Fails on Android 12 Due to Splash Screen API
message: App crashes or shows black screen on Android 12+.
causes: Android 12 Splash Screen API changes not handled.
Custom splash screen implementation conflicting with new API.
Missing migration to `react-native-splash-screen` updates.
solutions: Update `android/app/src/main/res/values/styles.xml` for Android 12.
Migrate to Android 12 SplashScreen API or disable it.
Use `react-native-splash-screen` and follow Android 12 guide.

title: React Native App Fails During Hot Module Replacement
message: HMR fails with 'Unable to resolve module' during development.
causes: Dynamic imports or file changes confusing Metro.
Corrupted Metro cache after rapid file changes.
Syntax errors preventing HMR from completing.
solutions: Clear Metro cache: `npx react-native start --reset-cache`.
Disable HMR temporarily: Shake device > Disable Hot Reloading.
Fix syntax errors and restart Metro.

title: React Native Gesture Handler Conflicts with ScrollView
message: ScrollView fails to scroll when using gesture handlers.
causes: Gesture handler intercepting ScrollView events.
Improper nesting of `PanGestureHandler` and `ScrollView`.
Missing `simultaneousHandlers` prop in gesture setup.
solutions: Wrap `ScrollView` with `GestureHandlerRootView`.
Use `simultaneousHandlers` to allow gesture coexistence.
Debug gesture priorities with `onGestureEvent` logs.

title: React Native App Not Building After Adding Native Module
message: Build fails after adding a custom native module.
causes: Missing native code linking in `android/settings.gradle` or iOS.
Incorrect module registration in native code.
Gradle or CocoaPods dependency conflicts introduced.
solutions: Link native module in `android/settings.gradle` and iOS `Podfile`.
Register module in `MainApplication.java` and `AppDelegate.m`.
Resolve conflicts: `cd android && ./gradlew dependencies`.

title: React Native App Fails to Connect to Backend in Emulator
message: API requests fail in emulator but work on real devices.
causes: Using `localhost` which emulator cannot resolve.
Emulator network settings blocking requests.
Firewall or antivirus interfering with emulator networking.
solutions: Use `10.0.2.2` (Android) or `127.0.0.1` (iOS) instead of `localhost`.
Set emulator to use host network: `emulator -avd <name> -dns-server 8.8.8.8`.
Disable firewall or allow emulator network access.

title: React Native App Shows Red Screen During Testing
message: Red screen appears during manual or automated testing.
causes: Uncaught runtime errors in test environment.
Missing mock data for API calls in tests.
Environment variables not set in test setup.
solutions: Check error stack trace on red screen and fix the issue.
Mock APIs with libraries like `msw` or `jest-fetch-mock`.
Set environment variables in test scripts or `.env.test`.

title: React Native App Loses State on Navigation
message: State resets when navigating between screens.
causes: Component unmounting on navigation.
State not preserved in a global store (e.g., Redux).
Navigation params not passed correctly.
solutions: Preserve state with React Navigation’s `useIsFocused` hook.
Use Redux or Context API for global state management.
Pass state via navigation params: `navigation.navigate('Screen', { data })`.

title: React Native App Fails to Handle Large JSON Responses
message: App crashes or slows down when fetching large datasets.
causes: Parsing large JSON blocking the main thread.
Memory issues due to large data in state.
Inefficient rendering of large lists.
solutions: Parse JSON in chunks or use streaming with `fetch`.
Paginate data with `FlatList` and `onEndReached`.
Optimize memory by clearing unused data from state.

title: React Native App Fails on Low Network Conditions
message: App crashes or behaves poorly with slow or no internet.
causes: No network error handling for API calls.
Missing offline state management.
Third-party libraries crashing on network timeouts.
solutions: Add error handling with `try/catch` for API calls.
Use `NetInfo` to detect network status: `@react-native-community/netinfo`.
Implement offline caching with AsyncStorage or SQLite.

title: React Native App Fails After Ejecting from Expo
message: Build errors or crashes after ejecting from Expo to bare workflow.
causes: Missing native dependencies post-ejection.
Incorrect configuration in `android/build.gradle` or iOS `Podfile`.
Expo APIs used without proper replacement.
solutions: Install native dependencies previously managed by Expo.
Follow ejection guide: update `android` and `ios` directories.
Replace Expo APIs with React Native equivalents (e.g., `expo-camera` with `react-native-camera`).

title: React Native App Fails to Render Fonts on Some Devices
message: Custom fonts load on some devices but fail on others.
causes: Font file format not supported on certain OS versions.
Font linking issues during build.
Device-specific font rendering bugs.
solutions: Use widely supported font formats (e.g., `.ttf`, `.otf`).
Re-link fonts with `npx react-native-asset` and rebuild.
Provide fallback fonts in `Text` styles.

title: React Native App Crashes on Orientation Change
message: App crashes or behaves unexpectedly when rotating device.
causes: State not preserved during orientation change.
Native modules not handling rotation events.
Layout issues with `onLayout` or dynamic styles.
solutions: Save state before rotation using `Dimensions.addEventListener('change')`.
Ensure native modules handle rotation events properly.
Use responsive layouts with `Dimensions.get('window')`.

title: React Native App Fails to Install on Real Device
message: App fails to install via USB or OTA with 'Cannot install' error.
causes: Incorrect provisioning profiles or signing certificates.
Device storage full or OS version incompatible.
Corrupted APK/IPA due to build errors.
solutions: Verify signing in Xcode or Android Studio.
Check device compatibility and free storage.
Clean and rebuild: `cd android && ./gradlew clean` or Xcode clean.

title: React Native App Fails to Handle Large Images
message: App crashes or slows down when displaying large images.
causes: High-resolution images consuming too much memory.
Images not resized before rendering.
Missing image caching or preload logic.
solutions: Resize images before rendering with `react-native-image-resizer`.
Use `react-native-fast-image` for caching and optimization.
Limit image dimensions in `Image` component styles.

title: React Native App Fails to Load Resources in Offline Mode
message: App shows blank screens or errors when offline.
causes: Missing offline asset bundling.
No fallback UI for failed resource loads.
Network-dependent components not handled.
solutions: Bundle assets in app: place in `android/app/src/main/res` or iOS project.
Add fallback UI for failed loads: `Image` with `defaultSource`.
Use `NetInfo` to show offline-friendly components.
